column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?
#Text=We can wait .
#Text=The shortage of workers is so severe , even if we do nothing , unemployment will come close to zero .
#Text=In the meantime , the FCP believes that only in a free-enterprise economy does the creation of wealth take place and productivity is best achieved .
#Text=The FCP supports the long-term removal of all measures that insulate industries , businesses , financial institutions , professions and trade unions from domestic and foreign competition .
#Text=Government intervention should be limited to work safety and protection of the environment issues .
#Text=Finally , governments cannot create wealth , but can create the conditions in which small businesses and corporations can create wealth .
#Text=The forces that contribute to the creation of wealth and jobs are need , ingenuity , labour , production , provision of services and the like .
#Text=The FCP will help the private sector to create jobs by reducing taxes to stimulate investment and increase the buying power of the average citizen .
#Text=What are your views on the mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) referendum ?
#Text=I support it and my party supports it .
#Text=Our current system is out-dated ( 1792 ) .
#Text=Under our current system 60%+ of the population is routinely not represented .
#Text=Under the MMP system , the legislature will reflect true voting patterns .
#Text=The burden of representation would decrease , on average , by 18,000 people for each legislator .
#Text=Further , “ list members ” under the new system would be better caretakers of the whole province , rather than thinking in solely regional terms .
#Text=The citizen ’s assembly worked on the MMP proposal for 8 months , and voted for it by a majority of 94 to 8 .
#Text=Lastly , in countries with an MMP-like system , voter turnout has increase by an average of 10 % , which is a good thing .
#Text=What role , if any , does “ new media ” play in your campaign , and the campaign of your party ?
#Text=( websites , blogs , Facebook , YouTube videos , etc )
#Text=Do you view it as beneficial , or a challenge ?
#Text=It would be a lot more beneficial to my campaign if I was n’t on dial-up !
#Text=I use email and websites , but technology is underutilized in my campaign .
#Text=The only disadvantage to “ new media ” is that it may not be effective in reaching some demographic groups ( e.g. , low-income , some seniors ) .
#Text=Of the decisions made by Ontario 's 38th Legislative Assembly , which was the most beneficial to your this electoral district ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
#Text=Which was least beneficial , or even harmful , to your this riding ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
#Text=Some investments in infrastructure was beneficial .
#Text=The province will benefit as a whole if MMP passes .
#Text=The persistent efforts to maintain an unsustainable healthcare system structure are the most damaging policies to the province , and the riding .
#Text=1 million people in Ontario still do n’t have access to a family doctor , and this shortage is even more acute in the North .
#Text=Life saving surgeries continue to be cancelled due to over-crowded emergency rooms , and the challenges in long term care are huge .
#Text=The longer we wait to implement Medical Savings Accounts , the more difficult it will be to manage the healthcare crisis .
